meanings.definition: A tropical plant with starchy roots, also known as cassava.
meanings.sent1: The mandioca plant grows in warm areas.
meanings.sent2: People use mandioca to make flour.
meanings.sent3: Why did the mandioca blush? Because it saw the potato peel!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as comforting as a warm bowl of mandioca soup.
meanings.sent5: The mandioca leaves rustled in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: The edible starchy tuberous root of the mandioca plant.
meanings.sent2: The market sells fresh mandioca roots.
meanings.sent3: The mandioca root rolled off the table and into the pot!
meanings.sent4: His words were as nourishing as a plate of mandioca fries.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of boiling mandioca filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: A staple food in many tropical regions.
meanings.sent1: In Brazil, mandioca is a common ingredient.
meanings.sent2: Families enjoy mandioca dishes during celebrations.
meanings.sent3: Why did the mandioca go to the party? It was a rootin' tootin' good time!
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like a pot of boiling mandioca.
meanings.sent5: The taste of mandioca brought back memories of home.
